etymology.description: Hand (又) stripping fur from an animal pelt (similar to 革); the pelt moved to the top-left and became abstracted.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a hand pulling off a hide, explaining meanings like skin and hide. Over time the pelt element was simplified and shifted to the upper left, while 又 preserved the idea of a hand. Sometimes confused with 叚 historically, though that has a different origin.

examples.chinese: 他摔倒时(他摔倒時)，膝盖的皮擦破了(膝蓋的皮擦破了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuāidǎo shí, xīgài de pí cā pò le.
examples.english: He fell and the skin on his knee got scraped.

examples.chinese: 这面鼓的皮很紧(這面鼓的皮很緊)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè miàn gǔ de pí hěn jǐn.

examples.chinese: 他们用牛皮做了一件外套(他們用牛皮做了一件外套)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yòng niúpí zuò le yì jiàn wàitào.
examples.english: They made a coat out of cowhide.
